content:
I think it was the combination of the tenderness and the flavor profile that really stood out to me. The brisket was so tender it just melted in my mouth, and the flavor was rich and deep with a perfect balance of sweet and tangy. I didn't get a chance to talk to the pitmasters or owners of Smoke and Dreams, but I wish I had!

As for trying out new types of wood chips, I'm open to exploring different options. I've been using cherry wood chips a lot lately and I love the sweet, fruity flavor it adds to my BBQ. But I'm interested in trying out some other options to see what kind of flavors I can create. Do you have any recommendations for wood chips that would pair well with brisket?
